The data store offers you:

Some of this data is free for all uses, some is chargeable for commercial use.

All data has terms of use. Refer to license and source links.

ColorGradientsModule.Color_gradients_are_used_to_represent_re: Color gradients are used to represent relative statistical data (population density, income per inhabitant, etc.)
ColorGradientsModule.Select_data_source_and_data_field: Select a data source and a value field. This field will be used to determine the colors. For example, a CSV workbook containing the French population by department and the densite_pop field containing the density data.
ColorGradientsModule.Select_geometry_layer_explanation: Select a geometry layer. The geometries will be duplicated and filled with the calculated color.
ColorGradientsModule.Select_join_field_explanation: Select a join field between the data and the geometries.
ColorGradientsModule.Select_parameters_explanation: Then select the characteristics of the geometries to create.
ColorGradientsModule.Data_source_contains_field_that_determin: The data source contains the field that will determine the colors of the geometries. The data source can be a map layer or a CSV format workbook.
ColorGradientsModule.Colors_applied_to_copy_of_geometries: The colors will be applied to a copy of the geometries of the selected layer.
ColorGradientsModule.Colors_depends_on_algorithm: The colors will be created in a new layer. Their values will be determined by the source field used, and by the type of algorithm.
ColorGradientsModule.You_must_select_a_value_field: You must choose a value field.
ColorGradientsModule.You_must_select_a_datasource: You must choose a data source.
ColorGradientsModule.Nothing_has_been_processed: No geometry has been processed. Processing has been misconfigured or the data is invalid.
ColorGradientsModule.Some_features_cannot_be_joined: ⚠️ Some geometries ({{invalidFeatures}}) do not have the {{geometryJoinBy}} join property. They have not been used.
ColorGradientsModule.Some_colors_values_are_incorrect: ⚠️ Some values of color field ({{invalidValues}}) cannot be used as numbers.
ColorGradientsModule.Some_geometries_does_not_have_data: ⚠️ Some geometries ({{missingDataRows}}) do not have data corresponding to their {{joinBy}} property.
ColorGradientsModule.Processing_done_with_warnings: Processing is complete, but it did not go as expected
ColorGradientsModule.Processing_was_interrupted_because_of_wr: Processing was interrupted because some data is incorrect
ColorGradientsModule.Processing_interrupted_data_must_be_grea: Values must be greater than zero and the minimum value must be less than the maximum value

DataSourceForm.Select_file_on_computer: Select a file on your computer. This file must
DataSourceForm.Be_in_CSV_format: Be in CSV format: comma separator, double quotes
DataSourceForm.Have_header_row: Have a header row with the name of the columns
DataSourceForm.This_source_contains_a_lot_of_data: This source contains a lot of data ({{rows}}), processing may take a long time.

GeometryLayerForm.No_geometry_found: This layer does not contain any geometry.

FeatureCountByGeometriesModule.This_module_will: This module will count the number of geometries present in each polygon of a layer.

DifferentSymbolsModule.This_module_will: This module will allow you to create symbols from a CSV workbook.

ProportionalSymbolsModule.Proportional_symbols_are_used_to_represe: Proportional symbols are used to represent absolute data (population, annual budgets, etc.)
ProportionalSymbolsModule.Select_data_source_and_data_field: Select a data source and a value field. This field will determine the size of the symbols. For example, a CSV workbook containing the French population by department and the population_2011 field containing the population data.
ProportionalSymbolsModule.Select_geometry_layer_explanation: Select a geometry layer. The geometries will determine the position of each symbol.
ProportionalSymbolsModule.Select_join_field_explanation: Select a join field between the data and the geometries.
ProportionalSymbolsModule.Select_parameters_explanation: Then select the characteristics of the symbols to create.
ProportionalSymbolsModule.Data_source_contains_field_that_will_det: The data source contains the field that will determine the size of the symbols. The data source can be a map layer or a CSV format workbook.
ProportionalSymbolsModule.The_geometry_layer_will_be_used_to_deter: The geometry layer will be used to determine the position of the symbols. In the case of polygons, the symbols will be positioned in the center polygons. In the case of points, the symbols will be positioned on the points.
ProportionalSymbolsModule.Symbols_are_create_in_a_new_layer: The symbols will be created in a new layer. Their sizes will be determined by the source field used, between the minimum size and the maximum size specified.
ProportionalSymbolsModule.Nothing_has_been_processed: No geometry has been processed. Processing has been misconfigured or the data is invalid.
ProportionalSymbolsModule.Some_features_cannot_be_joined: ⚠️ Some geometries ({{invalidFeatures}}) do not have the {{geometryJoinBy}} join property. They have not been used.
ProportionalSymbolsModule.Some_colors_values_are_incorrect: ⚠️ Some values of size field ({{invalidValues}}) cannot be used as numbers.
ProportionalSymbolsModule.Some_geometries_does_not_have_data: ⚠️ Some geometries ({{missingDataRows}}) do not have data corresponding to their {{joinBy}} property.
ProportionalSymbolsModule.Processing_done_with_warnings: Processing is complete, but it did not go as expected

ScriptsModule.Script_module_allow_advanced_data_modifi: The script execution module is used to process map data programmatically by writing JavaScript code.
ScriptsModule.Dont_use_it_if_you_dont_understand_it: If you do not understand what this module is for, do not use it
ScriptsModule.Dont_run_code_you_dont_understand: Don't run code you don't understand
ScriptsModule.Actions_cannot_be_undone: Actions performed by a script cannot be undone
ScriptsModule.Improper_use_can_cause_security_issue: Improper use of this module may present a security risk
ScriptsModule.Do_you_want_to_load_an_example: Do you want to load an example ? They show the possibilities of scripts:

ArtefactGeneratorModule.Generate_data_store_artefacts: Generate data store artifacts. Unless you are administering an Abc-Map instance, this module is useless.
